note.p: Birth: Almora, a hill station in the North-Western provinces, India (13 May 1857)
Education: DPH (United Colleges, London); St Bartholomew's Hospital Medical School, London

Career: Ship's Surgeon (for one year); Madras serveice, Indian Medical Service (from 1881); Major; researched the spread of malaria and proved it was carried by mosquitos, for which he won the Nobel Prize; worked at the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine; settled in London (1912)
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1909; Nobel Prize (Physiology or Medicine) 1902
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1932-1935 vol l pp 108-114, plate, by George Henry Falkiner Nuttall
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332
